title: How to Preserve Berries for Floral Arrangements

steps.title: Cut the berries with plenty of stem left intact.
steps.content: Cut the berries with plenty of stem left intact. The stem is essential for allowing the berries to be included in any floral arrangement.

steps.title: Cut the stems at an angle.
steps.content: Cut the stems at an angle. This allows for maximum surface to uptake water.

steps.title: Stand the stems in a vase or container of warm water.
steps.content: Stand the stems in a vase or container of warm water. Let stand for several hours.

steps.title: Place the vase or container holding the berries on their stems inside an upended box.
steps.content: Place the vase or container holding the berries on their stems inside an upended box. The box will prevent over spray onto non-work surfaces.

steps.title: Spray the berries with hair spray.
steps.content: Spray the berries with hair spray. Be sure to get all of the berries and coat all surfaces evenly.

steps.title: Use a polyurethane spray varnish if you also want gloss.
steps.content: Use a polyurethane spray varnish if you also want gloss. This also gives additional preservation to the berries. Spray two light layers, allowing for drying in between.

steps.title: Arrange the berries.
steps.content: Arrange the berries. Once the sprays have dried properly, the berries are now ready to be included as part of your floral arrangement.
